to promise to do something or to promise that something will happen
The law guarantees equal rights for men and women.
I guarantee you’ll love this film.
If you send the application form in straight away, I can guarantee you an interview.
I cannot guarantee to work for more than a year.
to make a formal written promise to repair or replace a product if it breaks within a specific period of time
All our products are fully guaranteed.
The stereo is guaranteed against failure for a year.
to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
to make it certain that something will happen
In movies, talent by no means guarantees success.
The built-in thermostat guarantees that the water remains at the same temperature all the time.
This latest incident is guaranteed to make the situation worse.
Even if you complete your training, you aren’t guaranteed a job.
a formal written promise to repair or replace a product if it breaks within a specific period of time
They offer a two-year guarantee on all their electrical goods.
Our computers come with a one-year guarantee.
Is your TV under guarantee  (=protected by a guarantee)?
a formal promise that something will be done
I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
I cannot give a guarantee that there will be no redundancies.
a promise that you will pay back money that someone else has used or borrowed, if they do not pay it themselves
something valuable that you give to someone to keep until you have done something you promised to do
The bank is holding the airline’s assets as guarantees.
guarantee.translation[1].note_box[0].sec: All our boots have a one-year guarantee for being waterproof.
The building work comes with a 30-year guarantee.
Our clocks carry a five-year guarantee.
The company offers a 30-day, money-back guarantee on all its products.
The binoculars are covered against manufacturing faults by a lifetime guarantee.
A full guarantee comes with every purchase.
to make a formal written promise to repair or replace a product if it has a fault within a specific period of time after you buy it
The car’s galvanized bodyshell is guaranteed a full ten years against corrosion.
to make a legal promise to repay a loan if the original borrower DEFAULTs (=fails to repay it or make interest payments on it)
The loan will be guaranteed by Bangkok Bank.
a formal written promise to repair or replace a product if it has a fault within a specific period of time after you buy it
For new home-owners, some builders have now given a 20-year guarantee against structural defects.
As the video camera was still under guarantee  (=protected by a guarantee), he took it back to the shop to be repaired.
an agreement to be responsible for someone else’s promise, especially a promise to repay a loan if the original borrower DEFAULTs (=fails to repay it or make interest payments on it)
money or assets held by an organization until someone has paid their debts, or debts that they might have in the future
creditor banks holding part of the airline’s assets as guarantees of earlier debts
